subject: Basketball
Free Agents (Sports)
lead_paragraph: The Dallas Mavericks agreed to a two-year, $4 million deal with guard-forward Eddie Jones, his agent said. Jones, 35, an unrestricted free agent, will receive about $1.87 million in the first year from the Mavericks’ biannual exception, the agent, Leon Rose, said. Jones, a three-time All-Star, has averaged 15.4 points in 13 N.B.A. seasons.
